sourceMeaningMnemonic: Bring <radical>rice</radical> under a <radical>canopy</radical>, crush it with your <radical>brush</radical>, and sweep the white powder in your <radical>mouth</radical>... it's <kanji>sugar</kanji> now! You make sugar by carefully crushing rice to a powder, until it's small enough to brush into your mouth.
meaningInfo: Taste the sugar in your mouth and feel the breeze waft under the canopy. You're surrounded by rice, but what's in your mouth is definitely sugar now.
readingMnemonic: You learned how to make <kanji>sugar</kanji> in <ja><reading>とう</reading>きょう</ja>. You found a special <ja>とうきょう</ja> sugar sensei and they introduced you to all of the secret methods you know now.
readingInfo: As you eat the sugar, you picture <ja>とうきょう</ja>. The place where you fell in love with these sugar-making techniques.
